title: TBLT-Based English Speaking Enhancement Course for Large-Scale Science Practitioners: Strengthening Scientific Inquiry Skills through Experiments, Presentations, and Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate English communication skills, basic practical experience in science (experiment design, data measurement, analysis), and understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion)
context.additional_context: Targets improving English speaking skills required by science practitioners in workplace settings, applying task-based language teaching (TBLT) for practical-focused education. Emphasizes language use training according to the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion), systematically learning specialized English expressions needed throughout scientific research (observation, data measurement, evidence analysis, conclusion drawing).

learning_goals: Improve ability to deliver 5+ minute English presentations in science workplace scenarios (e.g., experiment results, research data analysis) with emphasis on scientific evidence presentation and conclusion derivation

In English discussions with peer practitioners on variable control and hypothesis testing methods, identify 80%+ of core arguments and meet four or more of five discussion checklist items across three or more sessions—focusing on observational data interpretation and analytical comparison

Perform 10 scenario-based role-plays simulating corporate environments (meetings, presentations, negotiations) and demonstrate natural English conversation meeting clarity (4+/5) and contextual appropriateness (4+/5) in peer/instructor evaluations—especially emphasizing ability to clearly explain measurement methods and analytical techniques in scientific evidence presentation

resources: English Language Textbooks for Science Subjects

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
